title: Grandma's Corn Pudding Recipe
description: Corn pudding with sweet corn and a custardy texture is the perfect addition to your holiday table. This easy casserole recipe bakes in just one hour!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Side Dish Vegetables Corn Corn Pudding Recipes Grandma's Corn Pudding 4.7 (1,096) 873 Reviews 119 Photos Grandma's corn pudding is comfort food at its best! This creamy corn casserole is easy to make with both whole kernel and cream-style corn, resulting in a custardy pudding that will be a welcome addition to your holiday table. Submitted by lisa cohen Updated on October 14, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 119 119 119 119 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 (2-quart) casserole Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This easy corn pudding is a little sweet, a little savory, and totally delicious. Trust us: There's a reason this old-fashioned side dish has stood the test of time. What Is Corn Pudding? Corn pudding is a creamy side made with stewed corn, butter, and milk. It often features a thickening agent, such as cornstarch, to make the dish extra decadent. Corn pudding originated in the American South and can be served all year long, but it's frequently associated with Thanksgiving. How to Make Corn Pudding You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this old-fashioned corn pudding casserole: 1. Whisk the eggs, then whisk in the milk, butter, sugar, and cornstarch.2. Stir in the drained canned whole kernel corn and cream-style corn.3. Pour mixture into the prepared casserole dish and bake until golden brown. How to Store Corn Pudding Allow the corn pudding casserole to cool, then transfer the leftovers to an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for up to five days. Reheat until warmed through in the oven or in the microwave. Can You Freeze Corn Pudding? Yes, you can freeze corn pudding for up to three months (though since it is dairy-rich, the texture may change a bit during the thawing process). If you plan to freeze corn pudding, it's best to cook it in a foil pan. Allow it to cool completely, then wrap the whole pan tightly in storage wrap. Wrap it tightly again in at least one layer of aluminum foil. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight and reheat until warmed through in the oven or in the microwave. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "I made this recipe for Thanksgiving and everyone loved it," raves Lisa. "Now, I am asked to make it for every family function! Quick, easy, and inexpensive to make! You won't have any leftovers!" "This is my favorite holiday dish," says Kimberly Conkling Brown. "Sometimes I even eat the leftovers for breakfast! Here's a tip: Dissolve the cornstarch in milk before adding it to the rest of the ingredients to avoid clumping." "This was a big hit at our family dinner," according to Donna Corea. "I made it a head of time and reheated for the dinner. It was yummy! Every morsel was eaten. I have added it to my holiday recipes." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 5 large eggs ⅓ cup butter, melted and slightly cooled ¼ cup white sugar ½ cup milk ¼ cup cornstarch 1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained 2 (14.75 ounce) cans cream-style corn Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 2-quart casserole dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk eggs lightly in a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add milk, melted butter, sugar, and cornstarch; whisk until well combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in drained corn and cream-style corn until fully blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour mixture into the prepared casserole dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown on top, about 1 hour. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,270 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Grandma's Corn Pudding 01 of 119 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 119 Photo by  SadBeer7048 12/24/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Can’t wait until Christmas to see if the family will like it…First time making it.😃 03 of 119 Photo by  FeistyWheat3630 11/28/2024 Worth the effort Easy to follow A keeper! After reading the reviews, I chose to use 3 eggs and to mix the milk & cornstarch before adding the other ingredients. I melted the butter, but forgot to add it into the mixture before placing it in the oven. I took it out and added the butter. Turned out great considering the unexpected hiccup. ;) Will be trying this recipe again soon!!! 04 of 119 Photo by  CozyTongs3663 11/02/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Worth the effort Great flavors I made my first corn pudding 40 yrs ago when my hubs and I were newlyweds. Unfortunately I lost the recipe and hadn't made one since, until recently, after finding your recipe. I wanted to present something different on our table for Canadian Thanksgiving this year. Your recipe was exactly as I had remembered it many moons ago. Delicious and easy to make. It must have been a big hit as my crowd lapped it up, and many asked for the recipe. Thank you. 05 of 119 Photo by  Evlpenguin35 10/23/2024 OK with tweaks I made this recipe because I couldn't stop singing "Corn Pudding" from Schmigadoon to the point I started googling recipies & driving my family mad by listening to the song quite a bit. Lol if you haven't seen the show, it's on Apple TV and it's hilarious.So to the review...I had some leftover fresh corn that I had boiled a couple days for a previous dinner. I shucked the kernels of 4 small ears and it was plenty. Very delicious but a little watery. Maybe I'll try and cook it a little longer next time. This could be moisture retained by the boiled corn.When I served it with grilled chicken & steamed broccoli, I added a pad of butter on top and added a little salt & pepper to taste. It was like eating a custardy corn on the cob.In the words of the Schmigadoon ensamble sings at the end of the song....YUM!!!!! 06 of 119 Photo by  Ketrina Harmon 08/09/2024 OK with tweaks Needs more flavor First time I made this, I made it exactly to recipe. I felt it had too many eggs and I felt something was missing. I rarely use cornstarch even though it’s great for puddings, custards, and gravies. My Mom said the basics are there but just need tweaking. So, I know you can substitute flour for cornstarch so that’s what I did. I used flour, 3 eggs, 1/2 cup sugar, salt and evaporated milk. I saw someone commented to add vanilla extract but I might try that another time just for added flavor. Time wise, My Mom said to pull it out of the oven when it hardly shakes and has browned edges. Tastes amazing and the consistency is perfect. My Mom is heading over for the other pan. 😋 07 of 119 Photo by  Marsha Frisby 01/06/2024 08 of 119 Photo by  TwistyJam3162 01/03/2024 The recipe was good. I substituted Jiffy cornbread mix instead of cornstarch and that was even better! Five stars after the change. Now it's a holiday staple!!!!! 09 of 119 Photo by  KeenBowl5117 12/26/2023 It is easy to follow the instructions. 10 of 119 Photo by  Msz Dee 11/11/2023 *First Tim Using This Recipe. Made It Also For Pastor And Minister's 24th Pastoral Anniversary At My Church.*I Really Like How This Looks. I Only Had One Can Of Cream Corn But, I Followed The Rest Of The Instructions As Stated. Hope It Won't Make A Difference In The Taste.🤔 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Corn Pudding IV 53 Ratings Kathy's Southern Corn Pudding 75 Ratings Corn Pudding V 292 Ratings Tomalito - Sweet Corn Pudding or Cake 10 Ratings Grandma Swallow's Corn Pudding 8 Ratings Thanksgiving Corn Pudding 49 Ratings Snacks' Crazy Sweet Corn Pudding 13 Ratings Smoky Poblano Corn Pudding 59 Ratings Chef John's Creamy Corn Pudding 79 Ratings Sweet Corn Tomalito 347 Ratings Fresh Corn Pudding 44 Ratings Thanksgiving Corn Casserole 19 Ratings Old-Fashioned Scalloped Corn 247 Ratings Jiffy Corn Casserole 126 Ratings Maja Blanca Maiz (Corn Pudding) 7 Ratings Broccoli-Corn Casserole 13 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Add milk, melted butter, sugar, and cornstarch; whisk until well combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir in drained corn and cream-style corn until fully blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Pour mixture into the prepared casserole dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown on top, about 1 hour.
